Key Match Events: Julian Alvarez scored the first goal for Argentina against Canada in the 22nd minute. Lionel Messi scored the second goal for Argentina in the 51st minute.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Messi played the full 90 minutes, allaying fears about an adductor injury. Ángel Di María was withdrawn, safe in the knowledge his last game before retiring from international football will be Sunday’s final.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey, the same location where Italy won the 1994 World Cup semi-final.
Others: Canada's spirited opening was subdued after Argentina took the lead. Canada continued to chase the game gallantly, even when star player Alphonso Davies was forced to depart with an apparent injury with 20 minutes left.
Weather or pitch conditions: The match was played on a strangely sandy and uneven surface. The temperature was hot and humid.
Historical comparisons or records: This was the second meeting between Canada and Argentina in the Copa América, with Argentina winning the previous encounter 2-0.
Notable head-to-head statistics or uniqu: Canada proved themselves to be the class of Concacaf by recovering to progress past Chile and Peru in the group before earning a last-four berth via a shootout win over Venezuela.
Announcements such as retirements or lon: Ángel Di María, another Argentina great, was withdrawn, safe in the knowledge his last game before retiring from international football will be Sunday’s final.
Others (continued): The defeat ended Canada’s impressive progress at the tournament – although they’ll play for third place on Saturday night.
